alert.note: Alert for Leake (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:01AM CDT until March 28 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma affecting Leake County. Yockanookany River Near Kosciusko affecting Attala County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farmland along the river is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon and will crest at 20.5 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yockanookany River Ofahoma 19.0 18.7 Wed 7 am CDT 19.1 19.9 20.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
